title: Current-carrying wires - force on wire in B-field

content.question:
A long straight wire lies in the plane of the page and carries a current <math alttext="I" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>I</mi></math>, as shown. The wire lies in a region containing a magnetic field directed into the page and the magnetic force exerted on the wire is <math alttext="F sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>.
The wire is then rotated such that the current is directed toward the bottom of the page. The magnetic force exerted on the wire in this orientation is <math alttext="F sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>. Which of the following correctly compares <math alttext="F sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> and <math alttext="F sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> and provides correct justification?

choices.label: <math alttext="F sub 0 is greater than F sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math> because after the wire is rotated the angle between the magnetic field and the wire is zero.

<math alttext="F sub 0 is greater than F sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math> because after the wire is rotated the magnetic field strength will decrease because of the magnetic field produced by the current in the wire.

<math alttext="F sub 0 equals F sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math> because after the wire is rotated, the wire is still perpendicular to the magnetic field.

<math alttext="F sub 0 equals F sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math> because the magnetic force exerted on the wire is independent of the angle between the current direction and the magnetic field.

content.answer: <math alttext="F sub 0 equals F sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math> because after the wire is rotated, the wire is still perpendicular to the magnetic field.
